string_table:
#include "text\eng\sak_strings_treasure.xml"
Well, now what? Will the arena matches stop, you close shop, and leave to search for happiness in different parts of the world?
Hold on, Marked One. Don't jump to conclusions, that was only one tournament of many.
Strange, but that's what I thought from the start. Well, open up those games!.
OK, Here's the deal. This time you won and became the champion of the Arena, but that's not a permanent title and it doesn't give any guarantee that you won't win your way into a box in the next tournament. Tournaments are arranged more-or-less regularly. Once or twice daily. Matches happen from 22:00 to 06:00, you'll be notified when they start by SMS to your PDA. While you're a champion, you have full access to all announced fights; that means you can personally decide what to use during the fights and in what order you'll fight in. We still have some rules concerning explosives. Grenades, RG-6's, RPG-7's, Gauss Rifles, and any other heavy weapons are barred. That's pretty much it. The Arena still needs to be cleaned up a little, so you can go to the bar and have a nice drink. Just don't miss the next fight. See you soon, hopefully.
Good stuff.
Well hello there, champ!
Hello. What's new here today?
Eh, you're impatient...we don't even have enough contestants yet. Come back a little later.
Good deal.
Congratulations. You guessed right.
It was not fate. Don't worry, next time you might be more lucky.
Here's your hard-earned cash.
Great battle! You deserve a reward.
Your victory will not be counted.
You'll be fined for violating the rules of the match.
Hello there, champion! So you decided to come on back to the arena, huh? I didn't find a worthy enough opponent to steal your title, but don't relax yet. Why don't we put on a show today? How about you wax two-or-three mutants? I caught some fresh ones specially for you.
Marked One, listen. You've got a problem. Warring factions have decided to unite against a common enemy.
And how is that a problem?
The problem is that the enemy I'm referring to...is you. Remember how many people you've sent to the other side? Well, the guys are refusing to fight you alone.
Hey there, Marked One. We've been getting full on mutants lately, we're almost running out of room in the pens. And nobody wants to fight them. Maybe you could free up some space for us?
We'll see.
Just think about it. The work's good. You'll help us entertain the spectators, and you'll earn some cash at the same time.
Great, Marked One. The Arena's open again, so quickly pick a match. Our schedule's quite full today.
Greetings, Stalker.
Hello, Marked One!
I've got a request.
Depends on what kind.
Could you include me in your notification list again?
Whatever you say.
Could you please stop sending me those messages?
No problem. I'll delete you from the contact list.
Could you possibly turn on a few more lights in the arena?
I'll see what I can do.
Please turn the lights back the way they were.
Turn them on, turn them off. Make up your damn mind already, heh.
DELETE MOD
Are you sure?
Yes
No
Forget it.
What kind of fights have you got today?
Nothing right now, wait until we re-open.
That's all for today. No more people want to fight today.
Choose.
Maybe some other time.
I changed my mind.
If you're absolutely sure of your abilities, might I suggest a timed match? These battles usually don't last long and demand some mastery in the art of death. There's a possibility of getting bonuses or even doubling your winnings if you win within the shortest amount of time. Remember one iron rule, you CANNOT kill your opponent after the timer runs out. If you do, you'll be fined the same amount as the winnings. I think you'll agree, it's better to stay with your own ass intact and with no prize than having to pay what you were supposed to win. And I need as many living contestants as possible for the other matches, so you'll be also helping me by following that rule. What do you say? Should I turn on that stopwatch?
Five seconds.
Ten seconds.
Fifteen seconds.
Twenty seconds.
Thirty seconds.
Forty seconds.
Fifty seconds.
One minute.
No.
I changed my mind.
Who are you placing your bets on?
Against.
Nobody. I changed my mind.
How much?
Ruble.
Maybe another time, my pockets are empty.
Eh, I don't care for that guy.
All bets have been registered. No more bets will be taken.
Let's roll.
Totalizator.
Do you want to earn some cash without risking your own ass? Then you've come to the right place. You can place bets in two modes: battles against the mutants or faction tournaments. It's simple. Just tell me who you're placing your bet on, hand me the cash, and stomp on over to watch the fight. If your bet wins, you get your money back with interest. If you guess wrong, then at least you got to watch an intense battle with the satisfaction of not getting shot at. What's your choice?
I changed my mind.
On the soldiers.
Military
Military.
Mercenaries.
Mercenaries
Mercenaries.
On Freedom.
Freedomers
Freedomers.
On Duty.
Dutyers
Dutyers.
On the loners.
Loners
Loners.
On the Bandits.
Bandits
Bandits.
On the dogs.
Dogs
Dogs.
On the boars.
Boars.
Boars.
On the Snorks.
Snorks
Snorks.
On the Bloodsucker.
Bloodsucker.
Bloodsucker.
On the lost ones.
Zombies
Zombies.
On the Chimera.
Chimera
Chimeras.
On the Burer.
Burer
Burer.
On the Pseudogiant.
Pseudogiant
Pseudogiant.
Mutants.
Finally, Duty has started delivering live mutants to the arena again, even some rare ones. Choose, who will be your next victim?
Battle with the Military.
The first thing that comes to mind is "What the freaking hell are these guys doing in the bar?". Thanks to their numerous connections, the Dutyers can allow this for themselves. There aren't many doubts as to the professionalism of these soldiers. They all have alot of experience behind them, which they received even before the Zone appeared. Some of these guys have been in Afghanistan, Georgia, and Chechnya, and they've even spent a few years raiding the Zone, so they're still sharp. They're armed with the best guns their Russian government can produce.
Match with the Mercenaries.
The Mercenaries are a very organized paramilitary group made up of many different private contractors. They carry imported guns, so they're not short on cash. Rumor says that they work for foreign interests and governments, in addition to Russian, Ukrainian, and possibly even Georgian clients. I'd call them a side-effect of Ukraine's government trying so hard to join NATO. Many locals try to keep as far away from them as they can, but to the military, they are like a sharp bone in the throat. They give the mercs the highest priority if they spot them, which kind of makes me respect their soldiers. The firepower of the mercs is hard to ignore, which is why some groupings even have contacts among them.
Fight with Freedom.
Freedomers are the arch enemies of Duty. They have alot of former Dutyers among their ranks, ones that rejected the "we are the last hope of humanity" ideology of that faction. That's one of the reasons why relations between the two factions are very tense, to put it softly. Even though Duty considers Freedom to be nothing more than a gaggle of stoned anarchists, Freedom still put up a hard fight. Freedom is definately more organized than that, and their guns and armor aren't that bad either. Duty had many of their best fighters cross over, so their experience in battle is something to be respected. At the moment, there's a cease-fire between the two factions, but it's pretty shaky.
Fight with Duty.
The Duty faction is our self-declared police force. It's thanks to them that we have fights to the death in our humble arena, in addition to them capturing mutants for me. Members of this faction regularly participate in arena matches to sharpen their skills and practice for future raids into the deepest reaches of the Zone. They are armed with the same gear as our government's Spetsnaz, with the best Warsaw Pact firearms available.
Battle with Loners.
The usual loners, ones that either stay away from or have yet to join any faction. You might see some familiar faces among them, even recognize the guy you shared a bottle with a few weeks ago. It's a good way to make some enemies or thin out your competition for artifacts. They're armed with a myriad of guns. Warsaw Pact guns, imported rifles, you name it, but I've yet to see them armed with anything that makes me jealous.
Fight with Bandits.
The usual party of Death-Row prisoners captured in the Dark Valley. They've been given rented guns, arena weapons, so don't think for one moment that they'll be shooting at you from rusted double-barrels and Makarovs they took from dead cops they killed back in '75.
Fight against the "Zoner Team."
Every faction is represented in this team. The number of opponents is slightly higher than usual, and all of them are dead-set on making you pay for all of their comrades that you killed.
I get it.
Your chances of success are slim. Are you sure you want to accept their challenge?
I've been through worse. Announce the match.
Battle with the mutants.
Here Stalkers from different factions kill off two mutants, or vice-versa, depending on how lucky they are. Which battle shall we watch today?
Faction tournament.
This is a tournament between factions. Each one tries to prove that they're better than the other. Small conflicts and disagreements between them are also solved here with minimal casualties. The rules are simple: there are a few teams, they battle each other until only one, the strongest, is left standing. Shall we begin?
Dogs.
Boars.
Rodents.
Snorks.
A Bloodsucker.
A Controller and a zombie.
A Chimera.
A Burer.
A Pseudogiant.
One on one.
One versus two.
One versus three.
One versus six. In other words, a bloodbath...
The arena will now close for cleaning and maintenance. No more matches today.
The time for matches is over. Whoever didn't make it on time, too bad.
And now the Arena opens again! Who wants to be the first to donate a litre of blood?
Anyone willing to participate in a match in the arena: come to the bar area immediately. First match begins in three hours.
Six hours left until the Arena opens.
Twelve hours left until the Arena opens.
A reminder to everyone: matches will resume in the Arena in exactly 24 hours.
The Arena will open in 48 hours, volunteers for matches are still being accepted.
Approximate time until the Arena's next opening is three days.
Barman.
Arena administrator.
Fellas! Some piece of shit has killed off Arnie! If someone finds this swine, please shoot him straight away! Reward guaranteed. The Arena is now closed for an unknown period of time, pay attention to the announcements.
We are pleased to announce that we have found a new Arena administrator. The Arena is open once again.
What the hell is this?! Some asshole killed the Arena administrator again! Can someone please stop this crazed animal already?
Listen up, you bastard! If I find out what your name is, you're better off shooting yourself! Don't wait until my guys find your sorry ass, they'll cut you for a long, long time.
All Stalkers in the bar! The Arena owner has been killed. Find the killer, it's about damn time we stop this shit once and for all.
Fellas, the guy in charge of the Arena has been killed once again. The killer is still nearby. Find him, but don't kill him. Just shoot his kneecaps out and throw him in a fire. Duty will then hang the remains of this piece of excrement by the main gate.
There's a little problem...Arnie somehow got himself into an anomaly while drunk. In short, he got ripped up, not even any bones left. So, you all probably understand, fellas, that there will be no more fights at the Arena until we find a new administrator. When we do, I'll let you know.
Goddammit, the new Arena administrator has disappeared. If someone manages to catch the scent of alcohol that he probably reeks of right now, and finds that drunk son of a bitch, immediately drag him back to the bar. I'll pay you, but I doubt you'll find him anyway. The Arena will be closed until we either find the administrator or someone to replace him.
I went to the bar to drink vodka. No loitering until I'm back.
I went to the bar to drink all your money...losers.
If someone needs me, search for me at the bar. I'll warn you now, though. There won't be any conversation unless you've got a bottle of Vodka.
Man, day after day it's all the same...just vodka, vodka, vodka. Anyway, I'm off to the bar.
